full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement 
#### Thermal Cycling System 
**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
**Solicitation Number:** WS4379954293
**Amendment Number:** 1
**Publication Date:** January 4, 2024
**Tender Closing Date and Time:** January 24, 2024, 2:00 pm EST

**Procurement Category:** Goods and Services (GD)
**Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
**End User Entity:** Public Health Agency of Canada (PHAC)

**Notice URL:** 
[https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18428413?extsite=MTg0Mjg0MTNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18428413?extsite=MTg0Mjg0MTNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==)

**Tender Description:**
The Public Health Agency of Canada requires a thermal cycling system to be supplied and delivered to Winnipeg, Manitoba.  A detailed list of mandatory specifications is provided in the attached Annex – Statement of Requirement. Bidders are required to submit a complete bid, including all required supporting documentation, by the designated tender closing date and time. Late submissions will not be considered responsive.

A complete list of the project details, requirements, and submission instructions can be found in the Ariba Discovery posting.

**Contact Information:**
For any inquiries or clarification regarding this tender, please contact Amanda Jordan from the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) at amanda.jordan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca. 

*Please note that the submission deadline has been amended to January 24, 2024, 2:00 pm EST. All bidders must adhere to this revised deadline.*

---

Issue #1: Mostly fixed the formatting for formatting purposes and readibility.

Issue #2: Removed most abbreviations and acronyms, and tried to maintain consistency in language and formatting throughout.

Issue #3: Most notably, extracted the most relevant information to put it into a more digestible format for the reader. 

Issue #4: Reformulated and shortened the text as per the instructions. 

Please handle this task as if you were a technical writer. 

However, please answer the following question before proceeding: 
What
